concept.title: ActivityCard
concept.shortdesc: Activity Card shows relevant blockchain events, as well as relevant off-chain activities

conbody.p: Activity Cards are something like a library of activities. They store data assigned to token and are closely related to Data Objects.

In the current version of TokenScript Activity Cards show the history of a token. This might seem trivial. But if you ever used dApps with a standard wallet like MetaMask, you know how important Activity Cards are. Usually the wallet just shows transactions, in best cases, it also shows the token involved. This might be enough for plain value transfers.

But if you have token interacting with smart contracts - like, renting a car, lending a token, exchanging tokens and so on - the information of a plain transaction gets close to zero. With Data Objects loaded with an Activity Card, the wallet can become smart: It knows what the transactions did: That they rented a car, lended or exchanged a token and so on.

In future releases of TokenScript Activity Cards will support more functions and data objects. They can structure what a user can do with a token, like allowing it to redeem some other token, restricting its transferability or linking it to something which happens in the future.
